event.name: FINISH_BEACON_PROTECTORATE_EMPTY
event.text: You've arrived at the Long-Range Beacon. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.

event.name: FINISH_BEACON_CYRA
event.text: You've arrived at the Long-Range Beacon. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.

event.name: CYRA_DEFEAT_JERRY
event.text: "Damn... damn it all to hell. I've failed you, Vance. And at the hands of some second-rate Renegade from U0 no less. I'm sorry Jerry. Give your uncle my... my best wishes..." With that, Cyra has been vanquished.

Jerry is devastated. "I thought... you didn't have to kill her... We could have talked our way out. This was a mistake. Now the blood of my friend is on my hands, and this all could have been avoided if I just stayed put! Damn it! Go on, leave me here. This was all a big mistake..."

removeCrew.text: It seems Jerry is gone for good. You'll have to carry on with your mission without him.

event.text: It seeems Jerry didn't survive the fight. An unfortunate and anticlimactic end to this story, but you don't have much else to salvage it.

event.name: CYRA_JERRY_SPARE_CREW
event.text: Cyra's ship is in poor condition, but before you can continue the fight, Jerry pulls you aside. "Please, whatever you do, don't kill Cyra. Her crew cannot keep the fight going at this rate - we can get through this without any more losses, as long as you hold back! Please, I know you're a mercenary and a Federation one at that, but there doesn't need to be more bloodshed today!"

event.name: CYRA_JERRY_SUCCESS
event.text: You've managed to hold out just long enough, and eventually Cyra's ship comes to a halt. Cyra herself has collapsed, unable to fight any longer, and she reluctantly surrenders.

With the ship neutralized, you dock at Jerry's request and he rushes aboard to meet Cyra. The wounded Ace is still alive, and with treatment could surely make it out in one piece, but something else is wrong. "I've failed. I had one job, one promise. I'm useless. Jerry... send my regards to Vance..." With that, Cyra draws out her gun, aims it at herself, and pulls the trigger.
Jerry has no idea what to say. "I... she didn't have to... oh no. I caused all of this. What have I done?"

choice.text: Don't blame yourself, kid. Vance would have gotten her anyways.

event.text: "What? No! Vance would never have hurt her, especially not with their history. I don't think my uncle even realizes what he's doing. He has a mission, and people go rabid about it. They'll die for him even when he's never asked for it. I need to see him, I'm the only person he'll listen to. I can talk him out of this... make him see the damage he's caused. I'm no good as a fighter, but maybe if you can take me to Node 17, I can put an end to this fighting for good." Jerry looks around him. "As for this ship... well, it's not much use to us anymore. I guess you can take the blueprints. Come on, let's... let's go. I don't want to linger."

"I... I failed... and the kid didn't even survive the fight. What have I done... Damn... damn it all to hell. I'm sorry Vance..." Cyra pulls out her gun, and with trembling fingers aims it at herself and pulls the trigger.

event.name: CYRA_JERRY
event.text: Nearby looms a massive cruiser unlike any you've seen. Aboard the ship are multiple Aces, and their leader, a short but powerfully built woman with long black hair: Cyra Black, the first MFK Ace. She eyes you, but she makes no motions to attack. "You harbor Wentworth's nephew on your vessel. I know you aren't dumb, though your actions might be. You and I both know you aren't getting out of this sector with the kid without going through me first. Give him back to me, or we'll have to do this the unpleasant way."

You refuse, and at Jerry's own request, you put him on the line. He tries to appeal to Cyra, but she refuses. "Jerry, I made a promise to your uncle that I would never let anything happen to you. I will die before I break my promise to Vance. If it's a fight you want Renegade, then it's a fight you'll get."

You aren't willing to go up against Cyra about this. Jerry will be in good hands anyways - it's not like he hasn't been under her protection for most of his life. Jerry seems a bit disappointed, but he doesn't fight back. A fairly anticlimactic ending to this story, but better than one with death.

removeCrew.text: It seems Jerry is gone for good. You'll have to carry on with your mission without him.

event.name: CYRA_DEFEAT
event.text: "Damn... damn it all to hell. I've failed you, Vance. And at the hands of some second-rate Renegade from U0 no less. Ugh..." Cyra has been defeated.

event.name: CYRA
event.text: Nearby looms a massive cruiser unlike any you've seen. Aboard the ship are multiple Aces, and their leader, a short but powerfully built woman with long black hair: Cyra Black, the first MFK Ace. She eyes you, but she makes no motions to attack. "I've heard word of your movements in this sector. I know who you are, but I don't care. I've long since retired, but I give you one warning. If you so much as hurt one hair on the head of Jerome Wentworth, I will personally see to it that your throat is slit. Understand?"
"Good. Then get out of my sector."

choice.text: Take this chance to attack her!

event.text: "Typical. Renegades always follow the same course no matter what. To the grave you go, then."

event.name: CYRA_JERRYMET
event.text: Nearby looms a massive cruiser unlike any you've seen. Aboard the ship are multiple Aces, and their leader, a short but powerfully built woman with long black hair: Cyra Black, the first MFK Ace. She eyes you, but she makes no motions to attack. "I've heard word of your movements in this sector. I know who you are, but I don't care. I heard what happened at the estate. You're lucky Jerome got out alive, or else you'd be dead where you stand. Don't test your luck. Understand?"
"Good. Then get out of my sector."

choice.text: Take this chance to attack her!

event.text: "Typical. Renegades always follow the same course no matter what. To the grave you go, then."

event.name: CYRA_JERRYDEAD
event.text: Nearby looms a massive cruiser unlike any you've seen. Aboard the ship are multiple Aces, and their leader, a short but powerfully built woman with long black hair: Cyra Black, the first MFK Ace. She eyes you, the fires of vengeance in her eyes. "You son of a bitch. Are you happy with what you've done? I hope you are. Because it's the last damn mistake you've ever made. You shouldn't have hurt that kid, but you did, and now it's personal."
Cyra draws out her rifle, wiping the barrel clean, then silently motions for her men to attack!

event.name: CYRA_JERRYGONE
event.text: Nearby looms a massive cruiser unlike any you've seen. Aboard the ship are multiple Aces, and their leader, a short but powerfully built woman with long black hair: Cyra Black, the first MFK Ace. She eyes you, but she makes no motions to attack. "I've heard word of your movements in this sector. I know who you are, but I don't care. I heard what happened at the estate. Yet, Jerome is not with you? What did you do with him?! That idiot, trusting a Renegade on their word! You SCUM! I will gladly wipe you off the face of this Multiverse with the business end of my gun."
Cyra draws out her rifle, wiping the barrel clean, then silently motions for her men to attack!

event.name: JERRY_SURRENDER
event.text: A sprawling city has been constructed on the nearby planet, but clouds of smoke block most of your vision. As you pull closer, it is evident some major conflict has occurred here. Medics hurry to treat wounded civilians left by the wayside, and burning wreckages have been haphazardly thrown into the faces of skyscrapers. Most concerningly, some of the wreckage seems to be... Federation?

Eventually, the civilians notice you watching them. Rather than trying to attack you, they surrender. "Please, we wanted none of this! We don't give a damn about your stupid war! Is what you've done here not enough?!"

choice.text: Accept their surrender, and the responsibility of whatever has happened here.

event.text: It's a lot of supplies for something you had no hand in - but this probably won't do anything to redeem the Federation in these people's eyes. You had no idea the Federation would sanction things like this though...

choice.text: We had nothing to do with this.

event.text: "Bullshit. Even if you weren't involved in this slaughter, you still enabled it! What do you think will happen when the Federation secures its grip of this reality? They'll come back, and they'll wipe this place off the face of the galaxy. Get out of our city."

choice.text: (Tully) Ask Tully to give them an explanation.

event.text:
Tully sighs. "This operation was not sanctioned by the admiralty... but unsanctioned massacres like this have been known to happen when the Federation has its back against the wall. The exact same thing happened in the Federation-Mantis War." Tully smiles sadly. "On a related note, while we were prosecuting the war criminals responsible... The Rebels needed highly trained human military commanders with a grudge against the Federation. Take a wild guess where they got them."
"We're not responsible for what the military does. We are civilians! We just want to live in peace." The civilian folds his arms. "If your Federation comes back, do you really think we will be spared?"
"It's my job to be sure of that. I can't say that the Federation ships will always behave themselves, but I promise that we take war criminals very seriously. As long as I can, I will see that justice will be done."
The humans on the planet seem surprised at Tully's impassioned promise. They seem skeptical, but the gesture is appreciated.

choice.text: (Jerry) Promise that things will get better.

event.text:
Jerry places his hands together in a plea. "Things are really bad right now. I understand. And that's why I want to help. I know that we're all aware of the wrong the Federation has done, but I think that I can get them to listen to me. Let's make this right."
One of the civilians panics. "Jerry, don't! You can't change them! It's not safe!"
"I know it's hard, but I wouldn't be doing this if I didn't have a good reason to believe it would work. If peace is possible... don't you think I should try?"
One of the civilians covers her face, clearly fighting tears. "You're too good for us Jerry..." The civilians insist on giving you their original surrender offer.

choice.text: (Medical Crew) Send someone down to treat the citizens.

event.text: The civilians are very reluctant to receive your help, but they're desperate for any sort of aid. "We couldn't live with not repaying this gesture in some manner... but I hope you understand just what you're fighting for. What do you think will happen when the Federation has full control of this reality? They'll come back and destroy all of us. Are you really sure you're fighting for the right side here?"

choice.text: (Medical Drone) Send a drone down to treat the citizens.

event.text: The civilians are very reluctant to receive your help, but they're desperate for any sort of aid. "We couldn't live with not repaying this gesture in some manner... but I hope you understand just what you're fighting for. What do you think will happen when the Federation has full control of this reality? They'll come back and destroy all of us. Are you really sure you're fighting for the right side here?"

event.name: JERRY_HANGOUT
event.text: Several ships are docked with a small inn. You assume you won't be welcome, but curiously the people inside don't seem to care who you are. A couple Rebel officers sitting around one of the tables even wave you over. "Ey, Renegade! Come join us!"

You sit down at the table and one of the Rebels welcome you, clearly already a couple bottles in. "I know this is... uh... unconventional, but hell! The big man's birthday is tomorrow, it's time for celebration! You aren't... really a Fed anyways, I suppose. Heh, can't say I agree with the whole Renegade business, but meh. Not a fan of those Universe 1 folks they keep sending over either..."
You listen to the Rebels talk in mild amusement, but the inn-keeper walks by and informs you that, if you intend to stay at the establishment and hold this seat, you have to buy a drink.

choice.text: Buy a drink and keep listening.

event.text: At your decision to stay, the Rebels cheer and you each clink your mugs together and take another sip. The soldiers introduce themselves from left to right as Spike, Tuffy, and Butch.

Only two drinks in, you can already feel your head getting lighter. Still, you sit at the table and listen to the cheerful conversation. Most of the talk seems to be topical - it seems they weren't lying about not liking the 'Universe 1 folks'. All three have plenty of stories to tell of entitled Aces and condottieri overstaying their welcome, thanks to uncomfortably intrusive quartering laws.

Eventually, the conversation begins to shift to Vance's star nephew, Jerome. The conversation even draws the attention of a few other neighboring tables, who pitch in their thoughts. It seems everyone in the inn who cares to voice their opinion unanimously agrees that Jerome's a stellar guy. You aren't quite so sure of it yourself just yet, but this isn't the kind of company to raise such protest.

Butch's words have begun to slur, but you aren't sure if it's him or you. As you wobble in your chair, the hysterical laughter has caught on to you as well. You think you catch sight of the innkeeper shaking his head and grunting in your direction, but you're too far out of it to really be sure.

The laughter finally subsides, and the stories of their Jerry continue to flow without limits. You learn more about the guy than you ever thought you would, but you don't hold on to a single bit of information said for the entire conversation. You think you hear something about Jerry being the best man at Tuffy's wedding, but that doesn't make much sense. You think.

Theee converrrsatioon begggins to slooowww as reeeallity beecommmess a bllurr. Allll comprreeehennssionn youuu haad isss gonne. Youuuu donn't feeeelll soooo gggood, bbbuuttt thhhee convversationnn you cannn't underrrsstandddd haasss youu enthrrrallled...

You black out, eventually waking up on your ship, the walls painted a new shade of dark purple and a demolished disco ball in the center of the room. In the corner also lie the other three from earlier. They get up not much long after, only to find Butch's ship in a burning wreck. "Well, shit. Damn it, I'm not gonna be able to fix that with a hangover. Blegh... say, considering you're a Renegade, I wonder... maybe if we work together, we could get rid of these Universe 1 ships once and for all. At least, until I work up the courage to ask command for a new ship."
You can tell the Rebels don't take kindly to you refusing them. They're obviously drunk, so you quickly take your leave.

event.name: JERRY_TAXES
event.text: You notice a small Rebel colony has been constructed nearby. On encrypted channels, they broadcast a simple offer to you, "We know who you are, but times are tough. The Aces here don't follow Cyra's rules anymore, they're taking orders from Universe 1. The taxes are heavy and we'll take any business we can."
"Of course, the one time we open our arms, and this is how we're treated! Screw the Federation, I'd rather be taxed 'til I'm bankrupt than submit to you tyrants!"
The Rebels are clearly disappointed, but they say nothing more.

Fortunately, the Rebels weren't lying, and you're welcomed onboard to trade. However, when an elite vessel, merely the equivalent of a police officer here, comes by and spots you, the Rebels make no attempt to stand by you as the elite makes an arrest!

Fortunately, the Rebels weren't lying, and you're welcomed onboard to trade. "We just can't stand by the Federation anymore after all they've done, but you're not all bad evidently. I hope you can walk away thinking the same about us."

You board the station, only for Rebels to pop out, guns drawn! "Federation filth, we knew you'd fall for this! You break your way into our sector, and we break our way into your FACE! Hahah... eh... that sounded better in my head. Whatever, you're under arrest."

event.name: JERRY_COLONISTS
event.text: Near the beacon is a large space colony, whose populace is moving about in a busy fashion.

choice.text: Hail them and ask if they can assist.

event.text: "Huh? Quit bothering us, Renegade. We're busy gathering our yearly tribute to Jerome. We have to hurry, we can't be late!"

choice.text: Promise that you'll free them from Jerome's tyranny.

event.text: "You'll... what? God damn it, I said leave us alone! We don't have time for this nonsense!" The colony dispatches an Auto-ship to chase you off!

choice.text: (Human Crew) Have your human pretend to be Rebel personnel and demand supplies.

event.text: The colonists sigh. "Sure, for the Rebellion I guess. We'll have a shipment of ammunition and scrap ready for you shortly."

The colonists gasp. "What, no, you can't show him now! We still need to finish it! What if he doesn't like it right now? What if it's missing just that little bit extra? I couldn't bear to see him so dissapoi-"
Jerry cuts in "No, I'd never be disappointed in you if you're trying your best. And you should know that full well. So please, quit worrying about whether you've done a good enough job or not. What you've done so far should be more than enough."
Jerry then greets the colonists in person, and you see the effort they've put in. They present him with a luxurious looking birthday cake, a handwritten card, and even a signed Ellie the Equinoid plushie. It's certainly impressive, though Jerry asks that they save it properly for when he returns from this mission. The colonists agree, and hand over some resources to help out.
You have no business with these people.

event.name: JERRY_COLONISTS_STEAL
event.text: The colonists are helpless, and hand over some boxes reluctantly. As you pilot away, you hear them shouting "Damn you, ignorant Federation pig! You're everything wrong with this galaxy! Jerry will show you!"
You pry open the boxes, only to find a chocolate cake with 23 unlit candles around it, and a hand-made birthday card. There's nothing in here practical for a military vessel.

event.name: JERRY_META_REBELLION
event.text: Traffic at this beacon is quiet. You pick up a distant signal - once you clear it up, you hear a cute little ditty: "Doo da doo, do do doo doo dadodoo do! Bah doo do do, doo do da doo da! Elllliiieeee, the Equiiiiinoiiiiid!" It appears to be a TV show called... Ellie the Equinoid?

Without much difficulty, you manage to triangulate the source of the signal to a moon orbiting a gas giant. A small habitat dome is well hidden, with a Rebel Engineer ship docked. The broadcast stops once you get closer, but it's too late - you already know their location. They signal their hailing frequency.

choice.text: Open a channel to the secret habitat.

event.text: A scowling man in a suit steeples his fingers as he sits. Behind him, more men and women stand, looking similarly intently at you. "Well done, Renegade. You've found us. Congratulations are in order." He claps slowly, as if mocking you.

"Well I guess you're even LESS informed than I thought." The man laughs haughtily. "We are the Meta-Rebellion. We... have achieved ideology in its purest form. While the rest of the rabble squabbles over borders and resources, stepping on lives to acquire power, only WE truly understand what it is to fight the system."

choice.text: What does this have to do with the TV program you were broadcasting?

event.text: The man stops looking haughty and looks annoyed. "Yes, well, we circulate media that the ESTABLISHMENT doesn't want you to know about. We know the patrol routes and when it's usually safe."

"Wow! Ellie's very own fanclub! And they're opposing the people who wronged Ellie!" Ellie laughs cheerfully. "Things keep going right for Ellie!"
"No way! Ellie?" The Rebels all crowd around the screen. One of them in the back shouts "I'm your biggest fan, Ellie!"
"Hahaha! Alright, good boys and girls! Come and join Ellie's righteous crusade! Neeiiigh! For the happiness of all children, we will slaughter any who censors Ellie!" The Rebels practically kneel. Well, at least Ellie found some fans who are as looney as she is. There are several volunteers who fight for the chance to get on board, and many others offer as much scrap as they physically can.

Stephan takes a moment to ready himself, and then goes into his meet and greet persona. "Why, hello there! I'm not sure if any of you recognize me, but I played a part in that show that you were broadcasting."
The Rebels have a momentary look of confusion as they realize who Stephan is. "Stephan? Visiting us? You know... I had always dreamed of meeting you. You could do a lot of good for our cause you know, getting the word out there-"
"Hold on - I'm going to cut you off there. Right now, I have a debt to repay the people on this ship. I think it's great that you're practicing your ideology, but... I don't think my show alone is going to do much good. There's so many more relevant changes you could make in Rebel space - stuff that might actually change things for the better."
The crowd of Rebels stand, stunned, in a moment of silence. Then they all start nodding. "Y-yes, of course. You're right. Maybe we have been frivolous. I was... um... thinking of making some drastic changes."
"It sounds like you're scared. I get it. But, that's the price of putting yourself out there."
Stephan continues to talk some sense into the Meta-Rebels. By the time he's finished, you find that one of the crew has decided to join you on your mission.

choice.text: Wouldn't someone who rebels against you be the biggest Rebel of them all?

event.name: META_REBELLION_TRICK
event.text: You explain that if the Meta-Rebellion are better Rebels because they're rebelling against the Rebellion, then someone who betrayed them (say, by joining a Renegade) would be the MOST Rebel of them all. At first the man in charge says "Hah, don't make me-", but he is cut off - the engineers behind them are all now aiming their weapons at each other. "...What are you doing? You can't just-" A fight breaks out. The winner takes a shuttle to come to your ship, and offers their services. However, their ship seems to have noticed your foul play, and attacks you!

choice.text: This is a waste of time. I'm leaving.

event.text: "As if! You know too much. We will have to dispose of you. Au revoir!" The feed cuts out, and the engineer ship comes to life!

choice.text: So... does that make you a potential ally to the Federation?

event.text: "Hah! Don't make me laugh. The Federation is even more establishment than the Rebellion. You're so insignificant to us, you're not even worth consideration."

choice.text: Wouldn't someone who rebels against you be the biggest Rebel of them all?
This is a waste of time. I'm leaving.

event.text: "As if! You know too much. We will have to dispose of you. Au revoir!" The feed cuts out, and the engineer ship comes to life!

choice.text: Wouldn't someone who rebels against you be the biggest Rebel of them all?
This is a waste of time. I'm leaving.

event.text: "As if! You know too much. We will have to dispose of you. Au revoir!" The feed cuts out, and the engineer ship comes to life!
The engineer ship quickly responds to your aggressive behavior. Looks like you have a fight on your hands!
You have no time to chase TV signals of a children's television show.

event.name: JERRY_COALITION_SPIES
event.text: There is a Rebel ship at this beacon. It keeps its distance from your ship.

choice.text: Hail them to ask why they are acting suspiciously.

event.text: The voice that returns sounds a bit off, like it's being digitally altered. "We will let you live, Renegade. Go now."

choice.text: Threaten to report them if they don't respond.

event.text: There is a pause, and then a response comes, this time unmistakably sounding like a Slug. "The Coalition isssn't here for you, Renegade. We're here to ssspy on and undermine the Rebelssss. Thisss isss the deepessst we've ever gotten in Rebel territory. It would be for both of our bessst interessstsss if we sssimply ignore each other and causssse trouble for our mutual enemy."

choice.text: (Mantis Crew) Entice their Mantis with the promise of a better fight.

event.text:
The Mantis jumps at the opportunity. "Bye, jerks! Better fights now! Spying is waste of time."
"You have ssssome nerve.... Eh, sssscrew it. By all meanssss take thissss idiot off of our handssss."

choice.text: Bribe them to delay the fleet to aid your interference with Rebel activities.

event.text: "Ssssure, that can be arranged. Kill asss many Rebelsss asss you can find."

choice.text: The Coalition is no better than the Rebels! Attack!

event.text: "Thisss isss a pointlesss fight, Renegade! The Rebelsss ssstand to gain from our conflict!" The ship doesn't hesitate to defend itself.
The ship stays true to its promise, not interfering with your activities.
Surprisingly, this ship has a Coalition crew! They do not hesitate to defend themselves.
The ship continues to remain at this beacon, not responding to anything your ship does.

event.name: JERRY_DEPOT
event.text: You have stumbled upon some kind of Rebel depot. Dozens of transport ships travel in queues towards the central warehouses, and a couple workers on the ground carry back and forth crates of supplies. Defense wise, it's not impenetrable, but a nasty looking Ace vessel is standing guard.
You power up the weapons and engage the Ace ship to access the depot.
No reason for you to go causing extra problems here. You have more pressing matters at hand.

event.name: JERRY_DEPOT_RAID
event.text: With the ship now out the way, it becomes clear why the defense was so lackluster - the supplies stored here are nothing more than humanitarian, and the Rebel citizens are likely in dire need.
You came here looking for military goods, but the citizens of this place need this cargo. Better to leave it.
You grab the supplies, knowing full well that the people of this sector likely need them more than you do.
You grab the supplies, knowing full well that the people of this sector likely need them more than you do.
You grab the supplies, knowing full well that the people of this sector likely need them more than you do.

event.name: JERRY_AUTO_REPLICA
event.text: An Engineer vessel appears to be working on an automated vessel painted in bright blue, with the words "To: Jerry, From: Smith and the Gang." sprawled on the side.

choice.text: Ask them what the Auto-ship is for.

event.text: The Engineers don't seem to recognize you as a Federation ship, or just don't care. "This, this is my magnum opus! An Auto-ship programmed with Jerry's personality! It just needs some finishing touches... Tell me, what is your favorite thing about the boss?"

choice.text: (Jerry) Jerry is on board, would you like to show him the gift?

event.text:
The engineer is startled. "What, he is? Well..." The engineer scratches his shoulder nervously. "It's not quite finished but... let me show it to you."
The engineer fumbles with his controls, and the Auto-ship comes to life. "Good morning, Smith. Do you want me to read your kids their bedtime stories again?"
"No no no, I'm..." He turns to Jerry. "I may have, uh, field tested his personality on my family." He clears his throat. "Look, it's Human Jerry!"
Jerry waves at the blue Auto. "Hello."
"Oh, you're the guy I'm modeled after. Hi there."

"Well, that's pretty cool and all, but I'm just wondering... why present someone with a copy of their own personality?"
Smith rubs his chin. "Well, I saw it like this: what is it that you don't already have that everyone else has?" Jerry stares blankly. "Yourself! Every person in the Protectorate is happier in your presence. The great tragedy is that the one person that doesn't have a Jerry, is Jerry himself!"

Jerry looks at you for a moment and then sighs. "Well, it's a nice gift and a great sentiment. I'm going on something of a journey so... Why don't you use it to lift everyone's spirits in my absence? I think if I really make you guys happy, then the greatest gift you can give me is that I'm making people happy in two places at once."
All of the engineers start to tear up. "Oh Jerry... you're the greatest guy of all time!" The engineers insist on giving you whatever they have laying around since Jerry is leaving his gift behind.

choice.text: Lie: His ruthless and unforgiving nature. Makes him a good soldier.

event.text: "Hah... what? That doesn't sound like him at all." The Engineer shoos you away and goes back to working on the ship.
You engage the Engineer ship. They try to plead with you, but you mute the comms and attack.

choice.text: Lie: His authoritarian manner of ruling over people. He is the kind of strong leader this galaxy needs.

event.text: "Hah... what? That doesn't sound like him at all." The Engineer shoos you away and goes back to working on the ship.
You engage the Engineer ship. They try to plead with you, but you mute the comms and attack.

"Indeed he is! There is but no one cooler. Perhaps I have not yet modeled this AI personality to match Jerry's personality enough yet... I must get back to work! Take this before you go. To the Rebellion!" You halfheartedly chant back and collect the free supplies.
You engage the Engineer ship. They try to plead with you, but you mute the comms and attack.
You worry not about the Engineers.

event.name: JERRY_MOCKBATTLE
event.text: This beacon is right in the middle of some action - two moderately sized fleets, one Rebel, and the other... Rebel still, but crudely painted in Fed colors, are at a standstill. The commanders of each fleet face each other, reciting incorrectly memorized lines from famous battles from the civil war.

You plant yourself between the two fleets, valiantly risking it all to de-escalate the conflict. Neither commander seems to appreciate it though, and you're met with a barrage of swearing and insults. Now, it's your time to say what you're going to say.

choice.text: The Rebellion's time here is limited. Stand down and submit to the Federation!

event.text: Your moving speech is only met with more insults. "Dipshit, get out of the way! You gotta RSVP to participate in these!" It suddenly dawns on you just what this is - it's a mock battle, staged by the Rebels. You look like quite the idiot, and it doesn't help that you just made a threat against the Rebellion. The referee, armed with actual weapons, chases you off!

choice.text: This is civilian territory! The Federation has better things to do than attack this place!

event.text: "What? What the hell are you talking about? Buddy, this is a mock battle. We're all 'Rebels' here. We appreciate the.. erm... concern, but no one's in any actual danger here. They give you some supplies, and though they say it's a gift for your good will, you suspect they just want you to leave faster.

choice.text: Hail the Federation commander and offer your support.

event.text: You try to communicate with the Federation officer, but for some reason they don't seem to be receiving any Federation signals. Frustrated at the commander's incompetence, you have to decide what to do now.

You plant yourself between the two fleets, valiantly risking it all to de-escalate the conflict. Neither commander seems to appreciate it though, and you're met with a barrage of swearing and insults. Now, it's your time to say what you're going to say.

choice.text: The Rebellion's time here is limited. Stand down and submit to the Federation!

event.text: Your moving speech is met with only more insults. "Dipshit, get out of the way! You gotta RSVP to participate in these!" It suddenly dawns on you just what this is - it's a mock battle, staged by the Rebels. You look like quite the idiot, and it doesn't help that you just made a threat against the Rebellion. The referee, armed with actual weapons, chases you off!

You have better things to do than deal with this now.
This isn't a battle you want to get caught up in. Time to leave.

event.name: JERRY_REBEL_DEPRESSED
event.text: "Is that a Renegade? Oh what's the use... We're never going to succeed." The Rebel doesn't move to attack.
If they're going to complain about their imminent defeat, then who are you to deny it to them?

choice.text: Ask them if something is wrong.

event.text: "It's just..." The Rebel sighs. "This ship has one of the worst service records of any active Rebel ship. Every mission we've been on has been an abject failure. We don't even have the honor of falling in duty for the cause. We're the laughing stock of the Rebel fleet. There's no way we can win against a Renegade. That's why they've left us here, where we're not as likely to screw anything up."

Jerry talks into the communicator. "Hey, I know things have been rough, but I just want you guys to know that I'm proud of you. You said it yourself, you're alive, aren't you? That's no small feat in a galaxy as dangerous as this one."
"Jerry? Do you really mean that?" The voice on the other side sounds choked up. "You have no idea how long we've needed to hear that. You really are the coolest guy in the galaxy."

choice.text: Put them out of their misery.

event.text: Their low spirits will hopefully give you a tactical advantage.
You peacefully step away without saying another word.
Whatever their issue, you'll take the opportunity to avoid a fight.
"What do YOU know? The fact that you're even here tells me that you could never understand our pain!" The Rebel captain's mood has shifted. You're going to have to fight them!
"A Renegade trying to cheer us up? I never thought I'd see the day." The Rebels drop some supplies for you to pick up.
"What are you trying to do here? Don't waste your time on us."

event.name: DISTRESS_JERRY_SHOOTING_STAR
event.text: A small unarmed ship insistently hails you as you draw near. "We represent the Dream Conjurers, a group which aims to bring joy and majesty into people's lives, especially small children and Jerry. We were bringing smiles to peoples faces by dropping asteroids into orbits, so that they would look like shooting stars... but a freak accident happened, and the asteroid we dropped may have in fact had a secret cache full of missiles that is now plummeting towards a populated city." There's a brief beat. "Please help them!"

choice.text: (Magnetic Arm) Swoop in and grab the missile cache with your magnetic arm.

event.text: You swoop in and grab it just in the nick of time. The cache is full of missiles and even a hidden ballistic weapon.
"Wow, you did it! But... I feel bad that we weren't able to make a bigger spectacle of it... Oh, what am I saying, at least nobody was hurt." They give you a small reward.

choice.text: (Damaging Pinpoint) Use your Pinpoint to precisely destroy the cache.

event.text: Your Pinpoint strikes the cache in just the right spot to detonate the payload. It explodes harmlessly in the atmosphere before reaching the city. The resulting scrap burns up in the atmosphere, resulting in a phenomenon that looks like a meteor shower to the city below.

choice.text: (Accurate Ballistic Weapon) Use a missile to precisely destroy the cache.

event.text: Your shot strikes the cache in just the right spot to detonate the payload. It explodes harmlessly in the atmosphere before reaching the city. The resulting scrap burns up in the atmosphere, resulting in a phenomenon that looks like a meteor shower to the city below.

Your shot strikes the cache in just the right spot to detonate the payload. It explodes harmlessly in the atmosphere before reaching the city. The resulting scrap burns up in the atmosphere, resulting in a phenomenon that looks like a meteor shower to the city below.

choice.text: The cache is already in the atmosphere and falling towards the city. Unless your aim is extremely accurate, you're more likely to hit the city than the cache.

event.text: Instead of rescuing the city, you fire several shots directly into the Dream Conjurers, destroying their vessel in short order. On the planet below, the cache impacts into the city, causing a massive explosion.
There is a large explosion on the surface of the planet.

event.name: JERRY_DREAM_CONJURER_REWARD
event.text: "KABLAMMO! You did it! That was amazing! I'm sure to the people of the city, it looked beautiful. Looks like you were the real Dream Conjurer today. Here's your reward!"

event.name: DISTRESS_JERRY_ZOO
event.text: A large advertisement for a zoo at this beacon helps you pinpoint the location of the distress signal. "Help, the animals are out of control! We can't get them back into their habitats!"
The animals are easily swayed by your mind control system. The proprietors of the zoo thank you profusely. "You've helped out these animals without hurting them. Thank you."
You lock onto the animals with your mind controlling weapon, turning them docile. The proprietors of the zoo thank you profusely. "You've helped out these animals without hurting them. Thank you."
Irwin effortlessly corrals each and every animal into their proper habitats. All the while, he educates the zoo proprietors on animal control and care. They are beyond impressed with his expertise.

choice.text: (Crystal Crew) Erect barricades to guide the animals into their habitats.

event.text: The Crystal crewmember skillfully shepherds all the animals back into their habitats using their lockdown ability. "You've helped out these animals without hurting them. Thank you."

choice.text: (Rock Crew) Have your Rockman use force.
Send your crew in to help calm the animals.
Can't send in crew with none onboard.

event.text: You'll let the Rebels handle this situation.
Your Rockman tries to forcefully push the animals back into their cages using its superior bulk and weight. Luckily, no animal is harmed. The proprietors seem grateful, if a little nervous.

Your Rockman tries to forcefully push the animals back into their cages using its superior bulk and weight. Unfortunately, the animals are spooked. In the struggle, one of the animals dies. The proprietors shoo you away after the debacle.
With the help of your crew, the zoo proprietors are able to guide each animal back into their habitat. Luckily, no animal is harmed. The proprietors seem grateful.
No matter how much they try, your crew is not skilled enough to help out in this situation. There's nothing else to do here.
One of your crewmembers gets a bit in over their head. In the scuffle, there is an accident and they are killed. The zoo apologizes, but it seems you'll be going on empty handed.

removeCrew.text: Your crewmember exits the Clone Bay no worse for wear.

event.name: QUEST_JERRY_ASSASSINATION
event.text: A Rebel ship jumps in behind you as you drop out of FTL. "I've been tailing you since you came here, outsider. If you're interested, I have a job for you. There's a certain officer who is... let's just call her 'problematic'. You're here to kill Rebels anyway, aren't you? Well, we'll give you coordinates for a juicy target and we'll both benefit. There's even a reward in it for you, if you follow through. Deal?"
"Perfect. You won't regret this, Renegade. We'll send you the coordinates, and our rendezvous coordinates as well."

choice.text: Attack them, we don't do business with Rebels!

event.text: "I should have expected as much!" The Rebel ship immediately arms itself as yours does!
"A pity... but you won't be making it any further with that attitude!" The Rebel immediately attacks on being refused.

event.name: QUEST_JERRY_ASSASSINATION_SPOT

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: There's a Rebel here you've been tasked with assassinating.

event.text: Arriving at the beacon, you spot your target refueling at a station. They do not respond to your approach.
They quickly disconnect from the station in order to respond to your assault!
"Why are you here, Renegade? I have no quarrel with you. If you are not attacking civilians, then we aren't duty-bound to fight."

"Hey, Eileen."
"Oh, Jerry? I wouldn't have guessed you were onboard. What do you need?"
"I don't know how to tell you this, but someone's trying to kill you. A Rebel asked this ship's captain if they would kill you!"
Eileen shakes her head. "I guess I shouldn't be surprised. A lot of high-ranking Rebels don't like my proposals. I just didn't think any of them would send a ship into the Protectorate with the sole purpose of killing me."
Jerry sighs. "I don't know what we should do here... is there any way we can figure out who sent them?"
"Leave that to me. Hail us once you've captured their ship, and we'll get to the bottom of this. We'll let you use this station."

"If you must know, we've been campaigning to make changes to the war effort to lessen the impact on civilian populations. We've finally made some headway, but it's slow work. Obviously we can't show weakness to your Federation, but the lives of civilians are too important to neglect."
"You Federation types are so pretentious. We would not be doing as well as we are if we acted as you do. Now leave me be, I have important work to do." She hangs up.
They quickly detach from their station to respond to your assault!

choice.text: Why would the Rebels listen to you? Peace is what the Federation wants. Victory is what the Rebels want.

event.text: "Back when the Rebellion was getting started, it was regrettable, but unavoidable that we would have to endanger civilians to be heard. But now we can fight respectably, and so we have a responsibility to."

choice.text: So it's only once you're winning that you get to have a conscience? What happens if the Rebellion falls behind again?

event.text: "I'm not saying I agree with the early actions of the Rebellion, but if we're going to change the galaxy, then we need to become an organization worthy of doing so before we win. I don't understand, are you really here to just interrogate my intentions? What do you care?"

choice.text: A Rebel told us to kill you. We wanted to know why.

event.text: "You're very principled, aren't you? I hope you don't mind me saying that we're alike in that way. If your goals are the same as mine, then you'll do me a favor. There are some Rebels who are very opposed to the changes I'm proposing. I might be able to find out who it is if you capture their ship. Just let me know when you have them. And feel free to take some fuel and scrap for the road."

choice.text: Just needed to know who we were killing.

event.text: She makes a bewildered sound as you come into attack formation. "I still... don't understand."
"Okay...?" She doesn't bother you any further.

choice.text: The Rebel movement was never founded on peace. You can't change who the Rebels are.

event.text: "Such close-mindedness. If we cannot change the Rebels, then you cannot change your Federation, and things will never get better." She hangs up.
They quickly detach from their station to respond to your assault!
"I'm glad you agree. So why have you come here? Your presence will only make things worse."

choice.text: A Rebel told us to kill you. We wanted to know why.

event.text: "That was all you needed, huh? Well, I respect your willingness to hear us out. There are some Rebels who are very opposed to the changes I'm proposing. I might be able to find out who it is if you capture their ship. Just let me know when you have them."

choice.text: Just needed to know who we were killing.

event.text: She makes a bewildered sound as you come into attack formation. "I still... don't understand."

event.name: QUEST_JERRY_ASSASSINATION_COMPLETED
event.text: Your target has been eliminated. In order to get your reward, you'll have to proceed to the rendezvous point.

event.name: QUEST_JERRY_ASSASSINATION_REWARD

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You've completed your assassination. Come here to collect your reward.

event.text: "Nice work. You've made our job much easier. Here's your reward."

choice.text: Open fire on them once they've given the reward.

event.text: They're unsurprised by your attack. "Hah! I wanted to kill you anyway."
Your employer slinks away, leaving you with some time to do something on your ship.

event.name: QUEST_JERRY_ASSASSINATION_REVERSE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You've been tasked with capturing the ship of the person who gave you the job.

event.text: "Well, well, well. You've been negligent, and it even seems like you talked to her. I think we both know we can't let you leave." Looks like a fight is inevitable.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_TOM
event.text: A strangely colored Rebel fighter rests nearby, its captain grumbling something incomprehensible. When he spots you, he shouts: "Federation ship! Do you know who I am?"

"I am Tom, the true protector of this sector! That naive idiot has no idea how the Rebellion works, he's only in charge because his nepotism-supporting uncle loves him so much! Well I'll show that bastard what for... after I kill you!"
"Ahaha! I've found you! You fool. Wait until Vance hears you're working aboard a Federation ship! Finally, your uncle will stop caring about you and get back to work on running this Rebellion!"

event.name: DESTROYED_TOM
event.text: Just as you defeat the Rebel ship, an escape pod ejects from it. Unfortunately, it doesn't get far before you collect it and bring it aboard. You open it and drag out the Rebel officer inside. They beg that you let them live.

choice.text: Accepting the Rebel without further means of ensuring his loyalty is too risky.
(Mind Control) Keep the mind control online in-case he does anything bad.
Free the Rebel and let them go.

event.text: As you grab the Rebel by the arms and drag him into the airlock he protests little. A tear rolls down his cheek as he stands up straight and accepts his fate. You close the airlock once again when his corpse has drifted a safe distance from the ship.
The Rebel is grateful for you sparing him, despite it meaning he must betray his original cause.

The Rebel puts on a facade of gratitude, which is shattered quickly when he pulls out a laser and blasts one of your crew! He shouts, "Rebellion forever!" before he is shot in return. You drag his lifeless body to the airlock and send him into the endless vacuum of space.

removeCrew.text: Luckily, your killed crewmember is already undergoing the cloning process.

event.text: The Rebel is grateful for you sparing him, despite it meaning he must betray his original cause. Looks like we won't need the mind control after all.

The Rebel puts on a facade of gratitude, which is shattered quickly when he pulls out a laser and tries to shoot one of your crew! Luckily, the mind control stops him and he drops to the floor. You hurry to drag him out the airlock.

"Tom, please. I'm not your enemy."
"You think you're so much better than me?"
"I never said anything like that."
"You know what? I'll PROVE that I'm better. I'll contribute more than you ever thought POSSIBLE!"
Tom has joined... whether you like it or not.

"Tom, please. I'm not your enemy."
"It's not fair. it's just not fair."
"Can't we just get along?"
"Whatever. Have your fun. I'll look after this place. THEN they'll understand who the real cool guy is."
Jerry sighs as Tom leaves your ship behind.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MV_JERRY
textList.text: "Bah, we didn't come to this reality to visit Jerry just to find Federation filth here instead! Out of our way!"
The Rebel ship at this beacon is no standard vessel - it's a Multiverse traveler like you, and it appears they're hungry for some Federation blood!
It makes sense for there to be heavy Rebel influence in this sector, but you didn't expect to be finding a Multiverse vessel!

"Finally we've found you!... wait, is this Jerry's sector? God damn it, now you've done it! If you've done anything to Jerry I swear to god that'll be the end of you! Well, I'm going to kill you either way, but you get the idea."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_JERRY
textList.text: You are traveling in a Rebel sector with security measures akin to their Stronghold, so it should be no surprise that you've run into a ship that actually wants you dead!
A Rebel ship approaches: you already know what to expect with these kind of encounters. Get ready for combat!
It seems this sector is not without threat after all - a Rebel ship approaches!
"Hey, you're not one of Jerry's friends! Who let you in here?" A Rebel ship attacks out of nowhere.
It seems your travel through this elusive sector will have to take a pause - a Rebel ship is inbound!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_JERRY_HELLO
textList.text: "Jerry?! Hey man, how's it hanging!" The Rebels are no longer trying to fight.
The Rebels are delighted to see their friend, and power off their weapons.
As soon as they see Jerry on your ship, the Rebels no longer seem to want to fight.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AUTO_JERRY
textList.text: "Prime Directive: protect Jerome from intruding Federation vessel. Do not resist destruction."
It's no surprise to find an Auto-ship in Rebel space, but for some reason you weren't expecting one here. Prepare for battle!

"Warning: Unwelcome Federation ship has entered the Jerome Protectorate. Please evacuate the system." The Auto-ship nearby scans your ship. "Oh. Warning: unwelcome Federation ship identified. Entering combat mode."
"Critical problem, Federation ship detected, threat to Jerome at least 2%. This risk has been deemed unsatisfactorily high. Preparing to exterminate."

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: You have this much time to defeat the Auto-ship before the building is evacuated!

event.name: JERRY_HOME

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of the Wentworth Estate and Jerome's home.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: A massive Rebel city has been constructed on the planet below. Somewhat off to the side is a massive villa, with lights so bright it hurts to look at them. Your computer informs you this is the Wentworth Estate. The Vance of this reality doesn't live here in practice of course, but if you had to guess, this is likely where his nephew is residing.

As you approach the massive building, comms from the surface confirm you've been spotted. "Damn it, that Renegade's made it to the estate. Evacuate everyone and dispatch the security detail!" Immediately, a heavily armed Auto-ship is dispatched to handle you. Looks like you'll have to be quick about this!

choice.text: On second thought, maybe this isn't such a good idea.

event.text: You reconsider the idea of storming this place.

event.name: JERRY_HOME_FAIL
event.text: It seems you've failed - scans show the last life signs have vanished from the estate, meaning Jerome has escaped. The Auto-ship flares up, sending you one last message: "Objective complete. Initiating 'sucks to suck' procedures", then self destructs. Talk about insult to injury.

event.name: JERRY_HOME_WIN
event.text: The Auto-ship has been defeated, and you waste no time salvaging before flying down to the landing pad where you see a team of evacuators - with high security detail, rushing to the largest cruiser available. Among them are several armed Aces, a tall and imposing commander dressed in black garments with yellow stripes, and a scruffy looking civilian. The man in black is no doubt who you're looking for. As you approach the group they draw their weapons, and you draw yours.

"Sebastian, it's okay. It's me. I want to talk to the other me."
Sebastian looks surprised. "Jerry? What are you doing aboard a Renegade ship?"
"I've been here before, in a very similar situation. I pushed past you, and I talked to the Renegades who came to talk to me. And they were good to me. Even though I didn't have much to offer, they still listened to me. That's why I want to talk to myself."
"I... see. Well, don't do anything funny." Sebastian steps aside and lets the other Jerry step forward again.
"Another me...? Is that really who you are?" The other Jerry asks.
"Yeah. I've learned so much more by traveling the galaxy than I did while I was sitting in our mansion. I still have a lot to learn..."
"You've traveled the galaxy?"
"I've been to so many different places, and I feel like I barely scratched the surface. I've seen alien worlds, Federation worlds."
"How? Why?"
"The opportunity just fell into my lap, I guess. Isn't that always the case with us?"
"Heh. It feels like it."
"I decided I was done being passive. I wanted to experience the world from a new perspective."
"But what is it you're trying to do?"

choice.text: Tell Jerry about the Rebel Flagship.

event.text:
You tell Jerry about how the Renegades are tasked with facing the Flagship.
"Jerry, you've faced the Rebel Flagship? Your uncle?"
Your Jerry clarifies. "Well, I haven't. The multiverse contains countless roads for us to go down. Not all of them lead to a fight between uncle and the Renegades."
"I hope you don't have to. I still want to have the opportunity to talk with him."

choice.text: Why don't you come with us?

event.text:
"You want me to come too?"
"Yeah, why not? It was good for me. It can be good for you too."
The other Jerry smiles. "Who am I to argue with myself?"
"I'll do you one better. Who are you to deny yourself, your best self?"
The other Jerry thinks for a moment. "How did you get past Cyra?"
Your Jerry's face falls. "Ah. Well... That didn't go so well in my time. She was... stubborn. But the Renegade gave her a chance. We can do it again."
Other Jerry nods. "I guess it's worth a try."
Your Jerry holds his hand out. "Let's do this thing."
The two Jerries clasp their hands together in an agreement, smiling at each other. All of the other Rebel personnel seem amazed at the sight they see before them as they watch from afar.

choice.text: Don't worry, our Jerry can handle that.

event.text:
"I suppose you can, can't you? You're much cooler and more experienced than I am."
"What I'm doing is nothing special. Anybody can do this, especially you. Jerry, even if you're going to stay here, there's so much more you can be doing. Please don't forget that."
"I won't. And don't you forget who we are. We're Jerome Wentworth. You make sure the Renegade doesn't fight until our Uncle has heard you out, okay?"
"You have my word."
The two Jerries clasp their hands together in an agreement, smiling at each other. All of the other Rebel personnel seem amazed at the sight they see before them as they watch from afar.

choice.text: Tell Jerry about the Rebel Flagship.

event.text:
You tell Jerry about how the Renegades are tasked with facing the Flagship.
"Jerry, you've faced the Rebel Flagship? Your uncle?"
"Yes, I have." Jerry adjusts his gun. "It... it didn't go the way I wanted it to. He wouldn't listen to me. He... he insulted me. It came down to a fight."
Other Jerry holds his heart and looks like he wants to collapse. "So if I go with you..."
Jerry sighs. "Maybe. I wasn't good enough to change his mind. I don't know if I could in good conscience tell you that you could change your uncle's mind. It's a painful prospect."
Other Jerry looks down. "I don't know what to think..."

choice.text: Why don't you come with us?

event.text:
"You want me to come too?"
"Yeah, why not? It was good for me. It can be good for you too."
"But won't I have to fight my uncle? I don't know if I can do that. He still has good in him. I know he does."
"I won't deny you your journey. When the time comes, you can talk to him. You have my word."
The other Jerry thinks for a moment. "How did you get past Cyra?"
Your Jerry's face falls. "Ah. Well... That didn't go so well in my time. She was... stubborn. But the Renegade gave her a chance. We can do it again."
Other Jerry nods. "I guess it's worth a try."
Your Jerry holds his hand out. "Let's do this thing."
The two Jerries clasp their hands together in an agreement, smiling at each other. All of the other Rebel personnel seem amazed at the sight they see before them as they watch from afar.

choice.text: Don't worry, our Jerry can handle that.

event.text:
"Maybe that's for the best. If there's nothing I can do, then I'd rather not be there when he has to go down."
"But there's not nothing you can do. There's so much we can do. And I intend to prove that again. Never forget what you're capable of."
"Are you sure I'm capable of that much?"
"That much and so much more. Give yourself a shot. You might be surprised at what you're capable of."
Jerry holds out his hand. The other Jerry clasps it in an agreement, both smiling at each other. All of the other Rebel personnel seem amazed at the sight they see before them as they watch from afar.

choice.text: Your time is up, Jerome! The Federation has come for you at last!

event.text: The man scoffs, pushing back his lustrous hair with his perfectly shapen fingers. "So the uncivilized Federation brutes sent by Universe 0 have gotten so brash and foolhardy they plunge themselves into matters of Vance, thinking wounding the chief of the Rebellion personally will stop his spirit or the glory of our conquest? When I heard the Federation was substituting a proper navy for rogues so loose even the Syndicate wouldn't take them, I laughed, and now I laugh twice! You are a joke! Hah!"

choice.text: If we're a joke, then killing you is the punchline.

event.text: "HAH! So now we're being clever, why I oughta-" The man is cut off by the civilian in the back of the crowd, his green eyes poking out from underneath a mop of hair and crooked spectacles. "Sebastian, please. Let me talk to them." Seems you were wrong in your assumption, as 'Sebastian' immediately steps down and apologizes to the young man, no older than his early twenties, addressing him as none other than 'Jerome'.

He nods. "Y-yes. Though most people call me Jerry. We meet at last, Renegade. If... if that's what you call yourself. Well. Here I am. Jerry Wentworth, in the flesh. Not what you were expecting? Never seem to be. People come from all over, and well, they set their expectations a bit high. So... you came here because you have a job to do, right? Well, go ahead." Jerry stretches out his arms as if he were giving you a hug. He's trembling, and sweating hard, but his eyes glow fiercely determined, as if you were the one on trial, not him.

You aren't going to pass up a chance like this. In one swift movement you draw your laser and shoot Jerry down. His knees buckle, his body collapses, but the look in his eyes never fades. His squad panics and call for a medical team, and you take your leave. As you go, you make sure to salvage the drone from earlier. Your mission was a success, but you can't shake the feeling that you made a mistake here...

You keep your hand by your side but never reach for your blaster. You look Jerry in the eyes for a solid minute before he puts down his arms. "Huh. Was this not what you came here to do? I'm giving you your chance. Aren't you going to take it?"

choice.text: You're of more use to us alive than dead.

event.text: "How... utilitarian? Though I'm afraid I'm not of much use to you. The Rebellion calls me a hero, but I haven't the slightest idea why. I've never done much of anything. It must be nice, being you... traveling the Multiverse, being cheered at the end of your journey and feeling like you've earned it."

choice.text: You don't think you're a hero?
You aren't what we expected. Killing you doesn't feel right.

event.text: "Well, I can't say I understand where you draw the line. But I've also never been in your shoes. What's it like being a hero to your people? Like, earning that title. The Rebellion calls me a hero, but I've yet to figure out why..."

choice.text: You don't think you're a hero?
I've had a change of heart. Think I'll be one of those pacifist monk types now.

event.text: "It's a bit late for that captain, don't you think? Or... maybe not. Not sure it would be a good thing anyways. You're a hero to your people, right? And I'm a hero to mine... Not sure what's so heroic about me, but at least you've got your mission. I've got... I'm not sure."

choice.text: You don't think you're a hero?
We've done too much to spare him now.

event.name: JERRY_HOME_RECRUIT
event.text: Jerry laughs but hangs his head in shame. "No... Look, it's probably clear to you now I don't follow in my uncle's footsteps." Jerry glances back at Sebastian and the rest of his security, who've been standing there awkwardly the whole time, "But people expect me to. Just carrying this name, the Wentworth name, is enough for people to think I'm special. My mother died when I was young, and I never knew my father, but had I never met my uncle, I'd probably be like, a gardener, a chef, or a librarian. I'm not a soldier, and I'm not a politician.
